Check if object is empty

Source: R/utils.R
is_empty.Rd

Checks if an object is empty (NULL, NA, empty vector, or empty data frame).

Usage

is_empty(x)

Arguments

x

Object to check.

Value

Logical value indicating whether the object is empty.

Details

The function performs the following checks in order:

  1. Checks if the object is NULL

  2. Checks if the object has length 0

  3. Checks if the object is an empty data frame

  4. Checks if all values are NA

This function is useful for:

  • Validating function inputs

  • Checking data frame contents

  • Handling edge cases

The function handles:

  • NULL values

  • Empty vectors

  • Empty data frames

  • NA values

See also

is.null for NULL checking length for vector length checking

Examples

is_empty(NULL)
#> [1] TRUE
is_empty(c())
#> [1] TRUE
is_empty(data.frame())
#> [1] TRUE
